history.text: Hey!
Good morning
So, have you seen this movie before?
Yes, I have, many times, it is a good one.
It is definitely a classic movie! I can't believe this movie came out in 1990.
Do you know what the Rotten Tomatoes rating was for it?
Yes, a classic, I'd agree. It is an oldie. No, I am a bit surprised. I like the humor in this movie.
Yeah it surprisingly got lower ratings.
Macaulay is a great actor in this movie, for being so young. I think he does a great job. The boobie traps are hilarious.
I see that it received a Metacritic Score of 63/100 as well.
Oh definitely! I feel like this was Macaulay Culkins best work!
The Cinema score is high however.
Yeah it is pretty high.
I didn't know that this film was directed by Chris Columbus.
I haven't heard of him, is he famous?
I feel like I have heard his name somewhere, but I cannot place what movie it was.
I see that Kevin was supposed to be 8 years old in the film! I can't believe all the traps that were set up by a 8 year old.
Joe Pesci was hilarious in this movie, as well as Daniel Stem. I think Daniel was my favorite.
Oh yeah, they were great! I think my favorite has to be Peter.
I think the beginning of the movie was still interesting, not "flat".
I don't think it was flat at all.
But then again, it has been so many years since I have seen this film!
I can't imagine landing in another country and then realizing that my child was home.
Do you remember when Kate realized he was missing?
Yes, I have seen it within the last 5 years maybe and I still enjoy it. It is fun to see how you always grab something new from each time you watch it. Yes, poor Kate, I would die. I have three kids.
Hahahaha! I'm sure you can't even imagine being in Kate's position. And I hope you never do experience that!
I still wonder if an 8-year-old would really do this good on his own. I was always impressed by how well he did and wondered how it would be in real life.
Yeah I wonder that too! I feel like he could have easily handled himself, there were just lots of inconveniences due to the other two.
Was it the first film when he was eating the ice cream in a hotel?
I can't remember that part of him eating ice cream...
love the review regarding the "adult-bashing" that is hilarious wording
Oh yeah I just saw that....sadistic festival. Hahaha!
I love the persistence of Harry and Marv, you would think after that many "falls" that they would give up.
No kidding, how humiliating!
I can't imagine how tired you would be flying to Paris and then flying all the way home.
Oh my goodness and so sad to leave that trip behind for this reason. I would be angry too.
And poor Kevin too! I can't imagine how sad I would feel being left behind.
But then again....maybe I would be excited being a kid alone.
Yes, I am not sure which feeling would win in my case. Definitely a mix of both.
Did his parents find out about Marv and Harry?
Yes, that is something I can't remember. Do they even mention that?
I don't know if they do, I see in the key scenes that Kevin keeps silent about the interaction with them.
But I don't remember in the end.
I think we are just about finished?
I think he stays silent, as you mentioned. Then the movie comes to an end, as I remember, so you don't know what happens.
Yes, I think we have discussed just about everything.
Alright! Have a good day!
You too!
